data.name: FormFeature
desc: specifies the operations on a user interface form, as supported by the XFormOperations interface.

items.name: MoveAbsolute
lines: moves the form to a record given by absolute position.

This operation cannot be executed without arguments. When executing it (i.e. when calling com.sun.star.form.runtime.XFormOperations.executeWithArguments()), you need to specify a parameter named Position of type long, which denotes the position to move the form to.

items.name: TotalRecords
lines: determines the number of total records in the form, including the potentially active insertion row.
This is not strictly an operation you can do on a form, but rather a state you can retrieve (and display to the user) using the XFormOperations's respective methods.

The state obtained here is a string, not a number. This is because in an UI form, the fact that the current record count is not yet known (since not all records have been visited, yet) is indicated by an asterisk (*) besides the record count.

items.name: MoveToFirst
lines: moves the form to the first record

items.name: MoveToPrevious
lines: moves the form to the record before the current record, if there is any

items.name: MoveToNext
lines: moves the form to the record after the current record, if there is any

items.name: MoveToLast
lines: moves the form to the last record

items.name: MoveToInsertRow
lines: moves the form to the insertion row, if privileges allow

items.name: SaveRecordChanges
lines: saves all changes in the form's current record, including changes in the current control which had not yet been committed to the form

items.name: UndoRecordChanges
lines: reverts all changes in the form's current record, including changes in the current control which had not yet been committed to the form

items.name: DeleteRecord
lines: deletes the current record, while honoring any registered com.sun.star.form.XConfirmDeleteListeners

items.name: ReloadForm
lines: reloads the form content

items.name: SortAscending
lines: sorts the form ascending by the field which the active form control is bound to.

items.name: SortDescending
lines: sorts the form descending by the field which the active form control is bound to.

items.name: InteractiveSort
lines: opens a dialog which allows the user to interactively specify a form sorting order

items.name: AutoFilter
lines: adds a filter to the form, which is defined by the active form control and its current value

For instance, if the currently active form control is bound to a table field named Price, and currently has a value of 100, then invoking the AutoFilter operation will put an additional filter Price = 100 on the form.

items.name: InteractiveFilter
lines: opens a dialog which allows the user to interactively specify a form filter

items.name: ToggleApplyFilter
lines: toggles the com.sun.star.sdb.RowSet.ApplyFilter property of the form.

items.name: RemoveFilterAndSort
lines: removes all filter and sort criteria put on the form.

Note that this does not apply to criteria which are part of the form's data source. That is, if you bind the form to the SQL command SELECT * FROM Articles WHERE Price > 100, then the Price > 100 filter will not be removed.
Effectively, this operation resets the com.sun.star.sdb.RowSet.Filter and com.sun.star.sdb.RowSet.Order properties of the form.

items.name: RefreshCurrentControl
lines: refreshes the current control
Basically, this means calling XRefreshable.refresh on the current control, if it supports this interface.
**since**
OOo 3.1
